availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Edmonson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Malinda Rhodes in Edmonson County on February 11, 1838. Father of Patrick F. Edwards, Otha S. Edwards, Andrew L. Edwards, Sarah A. Edwards, Elizabeth A. Edward, George Ann Edwards, Malinda P. Edwards, Catharine Edwards, Mary L. Edwards, Levi Porter Edwards. Laborer in Edmonson County in 1850. Farmer in Brownsville, Edmonson County, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, pp. 13B-14A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, Brownsville, p. 23.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Edmonson County Marriages, Film #000367220, p. 90.
